intro: Homalanthus stokesii, commonly known as Stokes' hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or loamy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
